event: Here is the table of events and timestamps:
diminished breath sounds on the left side
coarse crackles in the right lung
decrease in breath sounds in the front of the chest
SpO2 level could not be maintained at 90%
oxygen mask with a reservoir bag at 10 L/min
admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU)
mildly elevated C-reactive protein (CRP) level (3.6 mg/dL)
respiratory failure with a partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood (PaO2) of 64 mmHg
extensive infiltration shadows, mainly in the left whole lung fields and in the right lower lung field
hematoma extending from the right basal ganglia and putamen to the thalamus
consolidations admixture with ground-glass opacities mainly in the middle lobe of the right lung and the upper and lower lobes of the left lung
antigen test for coronavirus disease 2019 negative
Streptococcus agalactiae and Klebsiella oxytoca in a concentration of ≥ 10^7 colony-forming units/mL
partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood/fraction of inspired oxygen (PaO2/FiO2: P/F ratio) 128.75
infiltration shadows observed at admission improved by Day 12
P/F ratio improved and was maintained at ≥250
transferred to the Department of Neurosurgery
transferred to a rehabilitation hospital for sequelae of stroke
